Question
========
What is the main advantage of putting your code in a saved `.R` script instead of only using the console?

Answerlist
----------
* It makes R run faster automatically
* It gives you a reproducible record you can rerun as a whole
* It disables syntax highlighting, so errors are easier to find
* It prevents you from using packages

Solution
========
Saving code in a script provides a reproducible record you can rerun (e.g., with `source()`), instead of relying on ad-hoc console history.

Answerlist
----------
* False
* True
* False
* False
